sources.title: Applause (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. One of the first sound pictures that filmed on location, this musical tragedy was a critical and commercial hit on release. In retrospective views it is still thought of as a cinematic innovator due to the technical aspects of the film.

metadata.Plot: This early example of the "backstage" musical genre tells the story of Kitty Darling, a fading burlesque star who tries to save her convent-educated daughter April from following in Mom's footsteps.
metadata.Actors: Helen Morgan, Joan Peers, Fuller Mellish Jr.
